results.title: The Revolving door
results.creator_credit: Vision Associates, Frank Loveland and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Examines the administration of justice in the area of minor crime in the United States. Shows the weaknesses of the established systems of lower courts and jails, pointing out that they are inadequate for the volume of offences and fail in rehabilitation. Narrated by Paul Richards.

results.title: The Revolution will not now take place
results.brief_description: Robert Conquest writes and narrates the history of communism from 1917 to 1969, showing that a true Marxist revolution of power to the people has never occurred. A masterly summary of 52 years of political history, this documentary includes a clip from the Halas and Batchelor animated film version of “Animal Farm”, Leon Trotsky reading a speech in English, Leonard Schapiro commenting on Stalin vs Trotsky and archival footage of historical figures such as Lenin, Stalin, Hitler, Churchill, Kruzchev, Fidel Castro, Ho Chi Minh. Stills filmed by Ken Morse.

results.title: The Revealing eye
results.brief_description: Surveys the history of cinematography and microphotography with many examples of the strides that have been taken in these fields. The history of the scientific study of motion through the cine-camera. High-speed, and time-lapse cinematography allied with X-ray and the microscope have made possible the study of movements and subjects which the normal eye cannot see. Experiments from 1890 to 1940, when it was possible to slow down the flight of a bullet so that one is seen tapping a piece of glass and passing through before the glass is shattered. Cinematography from space rockets. The use of colour photography in the schlieren technique.

results.title: The Return of the soldier
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Barry R Cooper Productions, Skreba Films, Ann Skinner, Simon Relph and Alan Bridges
results.brief_description: It is 1916. A shell-shocked soldier (Alan Bates) is sent home to the tranquillity of his English estate, his beautiful but spoilt wife Kitty (Julie Christie) and adoring cousin (Ann-Margret). But he barely remembers Kitty and can only find happiness with his first love (Glenda Jackson), who is from a lower class and now married to a schoolteacher. Kitty, however, wants him back whatever the cost. Adapted by Hugh Whitemore from the novel by Rebecca West, with music by Richard Rodney Bennett. Also stars Frank Finlay and Ian Holm.

results.title: The Return of the god of gamblers [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Win's Movie Production, Golden Harvest, Jimmy Heung and Wong Jing
results.brief_description: Ko Chun, the God of Gamblers, returns living a wealthy life but a rival appears, killing his pregnant wife and soon to be son. Before dying, his wife tells him not to gamble for one year and not to reveal his identity as the God of Gamblers. A year almost passes, and the gambler lives a forgiving life, until the man who kills his wife appears, taking revenge into his own hands. Cast includes Chow Yun-Fat, Tony Leung. Dubbed in English.

results.title: The Return of Captain Invincible
results.creator_credit: Seven Keys, Willarra and Philippe Mora
results.brief_description: Captain Invincible was once the world’s greatest super-hero before he was falsely accused of treason and dishonourably discharged from active service 30 years ago. The United States President calls on his childhood hero, now aging and an alcoholic, to save the world from the evil Mr Midnight. Stars Alan Arkin, Christopher Lee with Kate Fitzpatrick, Bill Hunter and Graham Kennedy.

results.title: The Return
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Films, Elizabeth McKay and Sture Rydman
results.brief_description: Edwardian England, a boarded-up mansion and rumours of ghosts provide some of the necessary ingredients for this compelling suspense film based on two short stories - “Nobody’s House” by A.M. Burrage and “The Middle Toe of the Right Foot” by Ambrose Bierce. A man who is seeking vindication of the man suspected of killing his bride shuts himself in the wedding room and confronts the ghosts of the bride.

results.title: The Restless Earth
results.creator_credit: BBC, ABC-TV (Australia), National Educational Television, Studio Hamburg and Sverides Radio Sweeden
results.brief_description: Looks at the earth’s geological history in terms of the ”plate theory”, with particular reference to Britain. Discusses the movement of the plates carrying the continents, the formation of oceans and mountains, and the occurrence of earthquakes and volcanoes. Introduced by Magnus Magnusson and narrated by John Gregson. (This is the Australian version with Australians - Peter Ross and Keith Michell- as host and narrator).

results.title: The Restless conscience
results.brief_description: A detailed documentary on the resistance to Hitler in Germany before and during World War II. The network of anti-Nazi activity in Germany that was active in the military and within the SS ranks from Hitler’s rise to power and into the war is profiled through discussion, first of the efforts by military leaders to gain the support of foreign nations in overthrowing Hitler’s government, and then of the range of assassination attempts and networks to smuggle Jews and other persecuted groups and individuals from the country. Through a collection of interviews including those with surviving members of the resistance and the families of those they helped, archival footage, and a critical commentary the program is a thorough exploration of the principles behind the movement as well as their activities.

results.title: The Research director
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Morten Parker and Ronald Weyman
results.brief_description: A description of the work of a research director of a United Steel Workers Union in Canada. The painstaking research and analyses of economic information, and the arrangement of arguments that lie beneath the negotiations of labour unions for better wages and working conditions are shown.
